Instructions: If you have LMS admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your People, Curriculum, Classes and Settings menus. If you have LMS report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in LMS reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

부서 이름과 부서 코드는 100,000개가 넘는 레코드에 영향을 미치므로 업데이트할 수 없습니다.

이 수업의 훈련 항목에는 테스트가 있으므로 '키를 통한 학점'을 사용할 수 없습니다.
본 수업의 교육항목은 설문조사가 없기 때문에 '설문조사'를 확인할 수 없습니다.
이 수업의 최대 등록 인원에 도달했습니다. 확인을 클릭하면 클래스의 최대 등록 수를 늘리고 선택한 학습자를 등록할 수 있습니다. 최대 등록 수를 동일하게 유지하고 선택한 학습자를 등록하지 않으려면 취소를 클릭하세요.
다음 학습자는 동일한 교육 항목에 연결된 다른 클래스에 이미 등록되어 있습니다. 이 학습자를 선택 취소하세요.
다음 학습자는 동일한 교육 항목에 연결된 다른 수업의 대기 목록에 이미 등록되어 있습니다. 이 학습자를 선택 취소하세요.
There is already a lesson with the title '#1' in the selected division. Please choose another title.

이 셀을 삭제하는 동안 문제가 발생했습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
레슨 셀 순서에 문제가 있습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.

기존 시험에서 문제를 놓친 학습자가 있습니다. 테스트를 다시 생성하면 누락된 문제가 제거됩니다. 너 정말 계속하고 싶니?

이 테스트를 미리보기 전에 문제를 추가해야 합니다.

이 클래스의 교육 항목에는 다음 전제 조건이 있으므로 다음 학습자를 등록할 수 없습니다: #1. 이 학습자는 아직 이 전제 조건을 완료하지 않았습니다.$10 $10 #2 $10 $10
연결된 교육 항목이 '#1'에 대한 전제 조건이므로 이 클래스에서 선택한 학습자를 제거할 수 없습니다. #2는 현재 '#1' 수업에 등록되어 있습니다. 선택한 클래스에서 #2를 제거하기 전에 '#1' 클래스에서 #2를 제거해야 합니다.
과정 제목이 '#1'이고 완료 날짜가 #2인 개인 훈련 기록이 이미 존재합니다.
이 설문조사는 활성 교육 항목에 첨부되어 있지 않으므로 미리 볼 수 없습니다.
이 수업에는 감독자의 승인이 필요하고 감독자가 없거나 감독자가 Frontline에서 활동하지 않기 때문에 등록할 수 없습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
삭제하려는 문제는 이 수업 및 관련 테스트에서 공유됩니다. 확인을 클릭하면 수업과 시험 모두에서 문제가 삭제됩니다. 레슨에서만 이 질문을 제거하려면 속성 탭에서 '레슨에 표시'를 선택 취소하세요.

아래 스크린샷은 보고서 표시 페이지의 기본 개요를 제공합니다. 이 페이지의 도구를 사용하면 보고서 디자인을 변경하지 않고도 기존 보고서의 데이터를 조작하고 분석할 수 있습니다. 그러므로, changes made in the report display are intentionally temporary. 보고서를 영구적으로 변경하려면 보고서 디자인으로 이동하여 원하는 대로 변경한 후 보고서 저장을 클릭해야 합니다.
페이지 오른쪽 하단에 있는 필터 표시를 클릭하면 같음, 포함 및 시작과 같은 일반적인 필터 유형을 사용하여 표시되는 데이터를 필터링할 수 있습니다. 아래 스크린샷에서는 필터를 적용하는 방법을 설명합니다.

The screenshot below provides a basic overview of the report display page.

Clicking Show Filter at the bottom right hand side of the page allows you to filter the data displayed using common filter types such as Equal To, Contains and Starts With. The screenshot below explains how to apply filters.

A summary report is a pre-built report that allows you to find information based on criteria entered in one or more fields shown here. The criteria can be entered by selecting one or more of the following:
  • A drop-down value
  • A radio button
  • One or more check boxes
  • A date value
  • One or more words in a text field
Note: With these reports, there is no need to use the wildcard character (%) in text field filters.
선택한 수준의 보고 권한이 없습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.

Keep Curriculum Dates? If this person is going on short term leave (STD) then it is recommended that you choose the Yes button to keep person's assigned curriculum dates in place. For any other circumstance, choose the No button. If you close this web dialog, your inactivation request will be cancelled.

Republish Lesson: You are about to re-import PowerPoint slide images or re-upload a PowerPoint presentation. If you continue, all existing lesson cells except for question cells will be deleted and the new cells from your PowerPoint will be added. Click OK to continue with updating the lesson. If you do not wish to change the lesson at this time, click Cancel.

Supervisor approval is required for this class. Are you sure you want to enroll the selected learner(s)?
  • Enroll & Wait will enroll the learner(s) tentatively. An email will be sent to their supervisor, who must approve or reject the enrollment.
  • Override will enroll the learner(s) immediately without supervisor approval.
  • Close or Cancel will close this message without enrolling the learner(s).

Instructions: To import learners from an Excel file and enroll them in the class "#1", please follow these steps:
  1. Make sure that your Excel file contains learners' names, user IDs or email addresses in one continuous column. The names, user IDs and email addresses must match those in Frontline exactly.
  2. Indicate whether the column in your Excel file contains learners' names, user IDs or email addresses.
  3. Browse to the file's location on your computer and select it.
  4. Enter the worksheet number (e.g., 1, 2, 3), the number of the first row (e.g., 1, 2, 3) and the letter of the column (e.g., A, B, C) containing the data. If the starting row contains the column name, select the check box.
  5. Click Import.
  6. Under Successfully Imported Learners (Select to Enroll), select the learners you wish to enroll; use the Check All button to select all learners in the list.
  7. Click Save to enroll the selected learners or Cancel to start again.

Step 3: In a hot spot question, learners must click on a certain region in an image to get the question correct. These regions, which are rectangular in shape, are called hot spots. You should add multiple hot spots to your image and designate one as correct. To add a hot spot, enter the coordinates of its top left and bottom right corners. To determine the X and Y coordinates of a point, place your cursor over the point on the image and record the two numbers in the status bar at the bottom of this window. The first number is the X coordinate, and the second number is the Y coordinate. After you have entered the coordinates of each hot spot, select the correct answer and then click Next.
Note: You can use the View Hot Spots link to preview your image's hot spots.

Step 3: Essay questions do not appear in lessons; they only appear in tests. Consequently, this essay question will only be used if you create a test from this lesson's questions with the Create Test link in the Lesson Layout. After you create the test, you will need to designate a grader for its essay question(s) in Author > Tests.

Step 4: Enter the messages that will be shown after learners answer this question correctly and incorrectly and then click Finish. If you will be using a remediation cell, then it is not necessary to enter these messages.

• If you will be creating a test from this lesson's questions, then you can indicate whether this question will be shown in the lesson only, the test only or both the lesson and test.
  • If you will be using question weighting in the test, then you can enter the number of points that this question is worth.

In a hot spot question, learners must click on a certain region in an image to get the question correct. These regions, which are rectangular in shape, are called hot spots. You should add multiple hot spots to your image and designate one as correct. To add a hot spot, enter the coordinates of its top left and bottom right corners. To determine the X and Y coordinates of a point, place your cursor over the point on the image and record the two numbers in the status bar at the bottom of this window. The first number is the X coordinate, and the second number is the Y coordinate. After you have entered the coordinates of each hot spot, select the correct answer and then click Return to Question.

Instructions: Use the New button to add new employees to the selected supervisor. To remove employees from this supervisor, select them and then click Delete. To move users to a different supervisor, select them, select the new supervisor at the bottom of this page and then click Assign.

Instructions: To add employees to the selected supervisor, enter your search criteria, click Search, select the users and then click Save.
Note: If you select the "Primary" check box(es), then this supervisor will become the primary supervisor of the selected user(s). If you select the "Secondary" check box(es), then the supervisor will become the secondary supervisor of the selected user(s).

Instructions: You can add personal training records for courses and classes that learners have taken on their own outside of Frontline. Learners can add their own personal training records using the Personal Training link in the desktop's My Data section. To add a new personal training record for the selected learner, fill out the fields below and then click Save.
Note: Personal training records are kept separate from learners' normal training records. To view all learners' personal training records, use the Personal Training report in Reports > People.

이 교육 항목은 더 이상 활성화되지 않습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
현장에 오시면 교육을 받으실 수 있습니다.
예정된 업데이트가 진행 중입니다. 데이터 손실을 방지하려면 가능한 한 빨리 로그아웃하세요.
지침: 교육 항목을 검색하려면 검색 기준을 입력한 다음 검색을 클릭하세요. 일반 검색에서는 교육 항목 제목, 항목 코드, 설명, 목표 및 키워드를 검색합니다.
지침: 이 검색은 부서, 회사 및 공공 도서관(액세스 권한이 있는 경우)의 모든 교육 항목을 검색합니다. 더 많은 옵션을 보려면 고급 검색을 클릭하세요.

제목, 항목 코드, 설명, 목표 또는 키워드에 검색 기준이 포함된 모든 교육 항목이 아래에 표시됩니다. 교육 항목을 실행하려면 해당 제목을 클릭하십시오.
참고: 검색 결과가 200개가 넘는 교육 항목인 경우 처음 200개만 표시됩니다.
지침: 이 검색은 선택한 라이브러리(부서, 회사 또는 공공)의 모든 교육 항목을 검색합니다. 더 많은 옵션을 보려면 고급 검색을 클릭하세요.
왼쪽 하단의 검색 기능을 사용하여 선택한 라이브러리의 교육 항목을 검색할 수 있습니다. 이 검색에서는 교육 항목 제목, 항목 코드, 설명, 목표 및 키워드를 검색합니다.
도서관에는 누구나 수강할 수 있는 교육 항목이 포함되어 있습니다.
교육 항목을 선택하면 자세한 정보를 확인하고 교육을 시작할 수 있는 교육 실행 페이지가 표시됩니다.
부서 라이브러리에는 귀하의 사이트/위치에 있는 교육 항목이 포함되어 있습니다.
회사 라이브러리에는 다른 부서의 교육 항목을 포함하여 회사의 교육 항목이 포함되어 있습니다.
공공 도서관에는 Frontline의 일반 환경, 건강 및 안전(EHS) 과정과 회사에서 만든 기타 교육 항목이 포함되어 있습니다.
라이브러리는 주제 영역, 산업 및 기술 코드, 항목 유형별로 분류됩니다. 왼쪽 트리에서 이러한 범주 중 하나를 선택하고 해당 하위 폴더 중 하나를 클릭하면 관련 교육 항목을 볼 수 있습니다. 자세한 정보를 확인하고 실행하려면 교육 항목을 클릭하세요.
참고: 이 페이지에는 모든 시험 문제가 포함되어 있습니다(질문 개수는 무시됩니다).
오류가 발생했습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
오류가 발생했습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
오류가 발생했습니다. 도움이 필요하면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
하나 이상의 학습자와 하나의 항목을 선택해야 합니다.
이제 모든 평가 질문이 완료되었습니다. 이전 버튼을 클릭하여 평가를 검토하고 변경할 수 있습니다. 평가를 완료하려면 학습자와 평가자가 아래에서 승인해야 합니다. 학습자와 평가자가 승인하면 관련 교육 과제가 완료된 것으로 간주되어 학습자의 Frontline 데스크톱에서 제거됩니다.
이 평가는 교육 과제의 일부입니다. 과제의 세부 내용은 아래와 같습니다.
평가자가 학습자가 유능하지 않다고 표시한 경우 해당 질문은 노란색으로 강조 표시됩니다.
질문은 평가 중에 제시된 순서대로 아래에 표시되어 있습니다.
각 질문에 대한 응답은 선택한 답변 열에 표시됩니다.
아래 질문은 테스트 중에 제시된 순서대로 표시됩니다.
잘못 대답한 질문에는 회색 확인란이 표시됩니다.
각 질문에 대한 학습자의 답변은 답변 옆에 작은 "귀하의 답변" 라벨과 함께 표시됩니다.

입력하신 사용자 ID 또는 비밀번호가 정확하지 않습니다. 다시 시도하거나 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 도움을 요청하세요.

참고:
  • 비밀번호는 대소문자를 구분합니다.
    • < li>비밀번호를 잊어버린 경우에는 사용자 ID를 입력한 후 비밀번호 찾기를 클릭하세요.

• 귀하의 Frontline 계정은 현재 비활성 상태입니다.
  • 계정을 다시 활성화하려면 현지 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.

• Frontline 사용자 계정이 올바르게 설정되지 않았습니다(활성 기본 회사가 지정되지 않음).
  • 도움이 필요하면 로컬 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.

• Frontline 사용자 계정이 올바르게 설정되지 않았습니다(활성 기본 부서가 지정되지 않음).
  • 도움이 필요하면 로컬 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.

• Frontline 사용자 계정이 올바르게 설정되지 않았습니다(활성 기본 계정이 지정되지 않음).
  • 도움이 필요하면 로컬 Frontline 관리자에게 문의하세요.
질문은 설문조사에서 제시된 순서대로 아래에 나와 있습니다.
각 질문에 대한 학습자의 응답은 선택한 답변 열에 표시됩니다.
SI Group Rotterdam Junction과 귀사의 계약이 만료되었습니다. SI Group Rotterdam Junction의 계약 관리자에게 문의하세요.
Shows the training items, MOC tasks, action items, event tasks and shortcuts on each user's desktop.
Lists all users along with many of the fields in People > People Information.
Lists each user's primary and secondary supervisor.
Lists your primary and secondary reports/employees.
Lists all users with admin and report permissions in LMS, MOC and ACT.
Shows all learners' personal training records.
Lists all users' permissions (e.g., Division Admin, MOC Power User).
Shows each learner's training records, assignments and curriculum.
Lists all training records (e.g., all training completed last month).
Lists all scheduled emails sent about upcoming or overdue training during the past year. After you run this report, you can click on a learner's name to see the actual email that was sent.
Enter your filter criteria, select a date range and then click <b> Run Report</b >.
Lists all training assignments (e.g., overdue training, training due next month).
Shows which learners are assigned a particular training item and which ones have completed it.
Allows you to view the training records of a single training item.

Shows all learner bookmarks in AICC, SCORM and WBT training items and training items with tests that have bookmarking enabled. If you need to filter the data, use the Show Filter link at the bottom of the report.
Shows all learners who are not assigned a particular training item or have not completed it within a selected date range.

Instructions: Apply filters on learners, search for and select a training item (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), choose whether to view learners with no assignments or no records for the training item and then click Run Report.
Shows all tests learners have taken within a selected date range and the learners' responses to the tests' questions.

Instructions: Select a learner and date range and then click Run Report (you can use your keyboard's CTRL key to select multiple learners). After you run the report, you can click on a test's title to see the learner's responses to its questions and other details.
Shows all learners who answered a test question in a certain way.

Instructions: Search for and select a training item (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select answer choices and then click View Responses to see the learners who selected those answer choices.
Shows the percentage of correct and incorrect answers for each question in a test.
Apply filters on learners, search for and select a training item (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Only includes training completed past the due date and overdue training assignments.
Lists training records grouped by training item within a selected date range.
Apply filters on learners and training items (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Shows the number/percentage of complete versus incomplete training assignments within a selected date range.
Shows the total number of training records and hours within a selected date range.

Apply filters on learners and training items (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Note: The hours are calculated using the "Hours Credit" field in Curriculum/Author > Training Items.
Shows the number/percentage of training assignments completed by the due date versus the number/percentage completed past the due date or not completed yet.
Apply filters on learners, select a date range and then click Run Report.
Allows you to select a month and year from a calendar and view learners' training assignments, training records and classes in that month.
Shows all assessments learners have taken within a selected date range and the responses to the assessments' questions.

Instructions: Select a learner and date range and then click Run Report (you can use your keyboard's CTRL key to select multiple learners). After you run the report, you can click on an assessment's title to see the responses to its questions and other details.
Lists all training items along with many of the fields in Curriculum/Author > Training Items.
Lists all skillsets along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Skillsets.
Lists all active components (training items) of skillsets along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Skillsets > Components.
Shows which components of a skillset learners have completed and which ones they have not.
Shows all skillsets assigned to learners both directly and through jobs.
Shows all training records of training items in skillsets.

Allows you to print a certificate for learners who have completed all training items in a skillset. Before you run this report, a Frontline administrator must set up skillset certificates in Settings > Certificates.
Lists all jobs along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Jobs.
Lists all active components of jobs, including skillsets and training items. This report does not include the components (training items) of skillsets within jobs.
Lists all active components of jobs, including skillsets and training items. This report includes the components (training items) of skillsets within jobs.
Shows which training items in a job learners have completed and which ones they have not.
Shows the active learners and training items in each job.
Instructions: Apply job filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select your report options and then click Run Report.
Lists all jobs, skillsets and training items directly assigned to learners. This report does not include the components of jobs and skillsets.
Lists all training items in learners' curriculums, including those coming from jobs and skillsets.
Lists all training items in learners' curriculums, including those coming from jobs and skillsets. This report also includes the learner's latest training record, if any, for each training item.
Lists all classes along with many of the fields in Classes > Open/Completed.
Lists all learners enrolled in open and completed classes.
Lists all completed classes within a selected date range along with the number/percentage of learners who attended each one.
Enter your training item and class filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary) and then click Run Report.
Lists all instructors scheduled for open and completed classes.
Lists all resources (e.g., classroom, projector) scheduled for open and completed classes.
Lists all learners with a status of "No-Show" in completed classes.
Lists all open classes within a selected date range along with the associated learners, instructors or resources.
Instructions: Enter your filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary) and then click Run Report.
Lists all learners on the waiting lists of open and completed classes.
Lists all class resources (e.g., classroom, projector) in Settings > Resources.
Shows the results of surveys attached to classes.
Shows all learners who answered a survey question in a certain way.
Shows all surveys learners have taken within a selected date range and the learners' responses to the surveys' questions.

Instructions: Select a learner and date range and then click Run Report (you can use your keyboard's CTRL key to select multiple learners). After you run the report, you can click on a survey's title to see the learner's responses to its questions and other details.
Note: The surveys that fall within the point range selected in Author > Surveys will be highlighted in yellow.
Select a survey and training item and then click Run Report.
Lists all accounts in Settings > Accounts.
Lists all divisions in Settings > Divisions.
Lists all companies in Settings > Companies.

Use this custom report to list Learners who have either not completed assigned training or completed it past the Due Date. You can display the number of Days Overdue for incomplete training and the number of days past due for completed training. Learners who completed training prior to the Due Date are not included.
Shows all learners' external professional certifications.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of all MOC tasks currently in a user's inbox. This will include tasks across other modules, like Action Items or MOC Sign Off notices. Use the Inbox Assigned Item field for the task name and Awaiting Action By for the assignee.
예정된 교육 및 기한이 지난 교육:
이 일일 이메일에는 Frontline의 예정된 교육과 기한이 지난 교육은 물론 직원(감독자인 경우)의 교육도 요약되어 있습니다. Frontline의 회사, 부서 또는 계정에 LMS 관리 권한이 있는 경우 해당 회사, 부서 및 계정의 학습자에 대한 예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육도 볼 수 있습니다.
교육을 완료하려면 #1을 클릭하여 Frontline에 로그인하세요. Frontline에 대한 기본 지침을 보려면 #2를 클릭하세요.
예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육을 표시합니다. 교육을 완료하고 모든 교육 과제를 확인하려면 Frontline에 로그인하세요.
직원의 예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육을 표시합니다(당신은 Frontline에서 이러한 학습자의 감독자로 지정됩니다).
직원의 예정된 수업을 표시합니다(Frontline에서 이러한 학습자의 감독자로 지정됨).
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 계정에서 예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육을 표시합니다.
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 계정의 학습자를 위한 예정된 수업을 표시합니다.
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 부서의 예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육을 표시합니다.
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 부서의 학습자를 위한 예정된 수업을 표시합니다.
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 회사에서 예정된 교육 및/또는 기한이 지난 교육을 표시합니다.
LMS 관리자 또는 보고서 권한이 있는 회사의 학습자를 위한 예정된 수업을 표시합니다.
이 이메일은 회사의 온라인 학습 관리 시스템(LMS)인 Frontline에서 자동으로 생성되었습니다. 질문이 있는 경우 현지 Frontline 관리자나 IT 헬프 데스크에 문의하세요(이 이메일에 회신하지 마세요).
여기에서 선택한 날짜는 MOC가 종료되는 시기를 나타냅니다.

Instructions: If you have MOC admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your MOC and Elements menus. If you have MOC report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in MOC reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

Instructions: If you have ACT admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your Action Items, Events and Elements menus. If you have ACT report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in ACT reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

Instructions: If you have CSM admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your Action Items, Events and Elements menus. If you have CSM report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in CSM reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.
이 부서에는 동일한 이름과 코드를 가진 장비가 이미 존재합니다. 다른 이름 및/또는 코드를 선택하십시오.
절차 제목 '#1'이 이미 존재합니다. 귀하의 절차에 대해 다른 제목을 선택하십시오.
참조 코드 '#1'이 이미 존재합니다. 다른 참조 코드를 선택하세요.
평가 요구사항 '#1'이 이미 존재합니다. 귀하의 요구 사항에 맞는 다른 제목을 선택하십시오.
구현 요구사항 '#1'이 이미 존재합니다. 귀하의 요구 사항에 맞는 다른 제목을 선택하십시오.
The route name '#1' already exists. Please choose another name for your route.
"You have already selected #1 as your agent during the specified date range.
지정된 기간 동안 이미 #1을 대리인으로 선택하셨습니다.
이 회사에는 '#1'이라는 제목의 작업 항목 양식이 이미 있습니다. 공개 보기가 선택되어 있으므로 작업 항목 양식에 대해 다른 제목을 선택해야 합니다.
이 부서에는 제목이 '#1'인 작업 항목 양식이 이미 있습니다. 작업 항목 양식의 다른 제목을 선택하십시오.
이 회사에는 '#1'이라는 제목의 이벤트 양식이 이미 있습니다. 공개 보기가 선택되어 있으므로 이벤트 양식에 다른 제목을 선택해야 합니다.
디비전 내 모든 이벤트 양식 제목의 처음 4자는 고유해야 합니다. 이러한 문자는 이벤트 번호에 사용되기 때문입니다. 다른 제목을 선택하세요.

To send a notice about this #1 to affected people, select the notice recipients (learners) by clicking on Add Skillsets or Add People, select a due date and then click Send Notice. The Add Skillsets link allows you to select groups of people, or skillsets, which can be created in the LMS.

The recipients are referred to as learners, because after the notice is sent, they will see an #2-type training item under the Training tab on their desktops with the due date you select; they will be required to review the #1 and sign off (the signoff records are kept with the training item in the LMS).

If you want learners to complete another training item before signing off on the #1 notice, click Select Prerequisite to search for and select the training item. They will be required to complete the prerequisite before signing off on the notice.

Note: If your search for people returns more than 1600 results, only the first 1600 will be displayed. If your search for skillsets or prerequisites returns more than 500 results, only the first 500 will be displayed.

이 MOC를 완료하려면 설명을 입력하고 확인을 클릭하세요. 앞으로 MOC 공지를 사람들에게 할당하지 않으려면 확인란을 선택하여 MOC 공지 교육 항목을 비활성화하세요. 이 MOC를 완료한 후에는 변경할 수 없습니다.
완료하려는 MOC는 임시 또는 탐색 MOC입니다. 이 MOC와 관련된 모든 임시 변경 사항을 제거하고 정상 작동을 재개했습니까? 그렇다면 이 양식의 나머지 부분을 작성하고 확인을 클릭하십시오. Frontline은 모든 MOC 참가자에게 MOC가 폐쇄되고 정상적인 운영이 재개되었음을 알리는 이메일을 즉시 보냅니다.

정상적인 운영을 재개할 준비가 되지 않았고 만료일을 연장해야 하는 경우, 본 MOC를 무효화하고 만료일 연장에 대한 재승인을 받아야 합니다. 무효화하려면 진행 중 폴더에서 해당 항목을 찾아 무효화 버튼을 클릭한 후 만료 날짜 연장 사유와 함께 무효화됨 폴더에서 다시 제출하세요. 진행 중 폴더에서 새 만료 날짜를 입력하고 필요에 따라 기타 변경을 수행한 다음 새 만료 날짜에 대한 평가, 공동 작업 또는 승인을 시작합니다.
개인 이름 필드는 비워둘 수 없습니다.
귀하의 에이전트와 정확하게 일치하는 항목을 찾을 수 없습니다. 검색하려면 .. 버튼을 클릭하세요.

To add new Personal Agent: Enter few characters of the last name of the person, click on 2 dotted button next to the Person text field, select the Person's name from the popup box, enter few characters of the last name of the Agent, click on 2 dotted button next to the Agent text field, select the Person's name from the popup box, enter a title for the Personal Agent, other information and then click on Save.
Note:You can add a personal agent if you find that one of your MOC Role Players did not set up a Personal Agent before leaving office and a lot of MOC tasks are held up on the person's Frontline Desktop.
MOC 개인 대리인은 없습니다. MOC 에이전트를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭합니다.
MOC 에이전트가 없습니다. 에이전트를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.
사용자의 전체 이름은 LMS > 사람 > 전체 이름 필드와 동일한 형식으로 지정되어야 합니다.
Select the types of tasks and roles you would like to reassign. The disabled check boxes do not apply to the existing assignee
변경 사항이 성공적으로 적용되었으며 아래 표의 첫 번째 행에 표시됩니다.
기존 담당자와 신규 담당자는 달라야 합니다.
귀하가 선택한 기존 담당자에게는 현재 #1 작업이나 역할이 할당되어 있지 않습니다.
잘못된 문자를 입력했습니다. 다시 시도해 주세요.

URL 길이가 500자를 초과합니다. 더 짧은 URL을 선택하세요.
사양 필드의 값이 500자를 초과합니다. 500자 이하로 입력해주세요.
이 장비는 MOC 또는 이벤트와 연결되어 있으므로 삭제할 수 없습니다. 대신 장비를 비활성화하십시오.

Instructions:To add a new piece of equipment, enter its name and code and then click Save. To attach an equipment specification sheet or drawing, use the Browse… button to find and select the appropriate file or paste the file's URL in the 'Specification' field.

Instructions: To add a new piece of equipment, enter its name and code and then click Save. To attach an equipment specification sheet or drawing, use the Browse or Choose File button to find and select the appropriate file.

To add new Procedure: Enter Procedure Title, other information and then click on Save.
Note:Procedure URL is file path to the document. These procedures can be viewed by MOC Originators as a guideline while creating a new MOC.

To add a new Procedure: Enter Procedure Title and use the Browse or Choose File button to upload a file.
Note: Procedure URL is the file path to the document. These procedures can be viewed by MOC Originators as a guideline while creating a new MOC.
절차가 없습니다. 새 프로시저를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.
사양 필드에 유효한 URL을 입력하세요. URL은 https:// 또는 http://로 시작해야 합니다.
유효한 URL 필드를 입력하십시오. URL은 https:// 또는 http://로 시작해야 합니다.
To add new Profile: Enter Title, Description, Priority, other information and then click on Save.
이 프로필은 하나 이상의 MOC에서 사용되므로 삭제할 수 없습니다.
이 프로필은 하나 이상의 사전 승인 바로가기와 연결되어 있으므로 삭제할 수 없습니다.

<u>Requirement Found</u>: Mouse over the title of the Requirement to view Requirement Description. The Requirement Title will show-up as hyperlink if there is any checklist associated with it.
"두 번째 통지 보내기" 요구 사항은 "공지 보내기" 요구 사항 다음에 주문되어야 합니다.
"통지 보내기" 요구 사항은 "두 번째 통지 보내기" 요구 사항보다 먼저 주문되어야 합니다.
'공지사항 보내기' 제목이 있는 요구사항은 삭제할 수 없습니다.

Add Requirement: Enter the Requirement search criteria, click on Search to display the requirements. To select an {0}, enter the first few characters of {0}'s last name, click on the button next to the {0} text box, select {0}, enter other information and then click on Save.
이 MOC 프로필에는 평가 요구 사항이 없습니다. 새로 만들기를 클릭하여 평가 요구 사항을 추가합니다.
이 MOC 프로필에는 구현 요구 사항이 없습니다. 구현 요구 사항을 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭합니다.

Instructions: To reorder requirements, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of nodes can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.

Instructions: To add default collaborators, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of collaborators can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC collaboration task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of collaborators with the same order number. After all such collaborators finish collaborating, the MOC will go to the next collaborator(s).
이 MOC 프로필에는 기본 협력자가 없습니다. 기본 공동작업자를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.

Instructions: To reorder collaborators, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of nodes can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.

Instructions: To add default approvers from a route, enter your route search criteria, click Search, select the appropriate route and then click Save.
Note: Routes are pre-defined approval patterns that you can create in Elements > Route. After searching, click on the route name to display the individuals and/or jobs in the route.

Instructions: The list of default collaborators for this MOC profile is on the right. Select the collaborators who will also be default approvers for the MOC profile, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the default approvers to be individuals or jobs. ext, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.
이 MOC 프로필에는 기본 승인자가 없습니다. 기본 승인자를 추가하려면 새로 만들기, 라우팅 또는 협력자 복사를 클릭합니다.
이 MOC 프로필에는 기본 승인자가 없습니다. 새로 만들기 또는 라우팅을 클릭하여 기본 승인자를 추가합니다.

Instructions: To reorder approvers, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of nodes can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.

To attach document to Profile: Enter the Title of the document, "URL and Description and then click on Save.
Note: The URL field is a file path to the document. The document can reside on a shared file server or a web site.
이 MOC 프로필에는 기본 첨부 파일이 없습니다. 기본 첨부 파일을 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭합니다.
Add Equipment: Enter the search criteria, click on Search to list all the equipment. Enter notes(if any), click on the choose check box and then click on Save.
이 MOC 프로필에는 기본 장비가 없습니다. 기본 장비를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.
업데이트 버튼을 클릭하기 전에 이 사전 승인에 대한 참조 코드를 선택하십시오.
작성자와 정확히 일치하는 사람을 찾을 수 없습니다. 처음 몇 글자를 입력한 후 .. 버튼을 클릭하여 검색하세요.
이 사전 승인을 삭제하면 사람들의 Frontline 데스크톱에서 제거됩니다. 삭제 하시겠습니까?
참조 코드를 선택하기 전에 유효한 구분을 선택하십시오.

Instructions: Pre-approval shortcuts allow users to submit MOC requests from their desktops. To add a new MOC pre-approval shortcut, enter a title and description, select a ref code and then click Save.
After creating the pre-approval shortcut, click the Pre-Approvers tab to add pre-approvers and click the People with Desktop Shortcut tab to add the shortcut to users' desktops.
사전 승인이 없습니다. 새로운 사전 승인을 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.
주문 텍스트 상자에 숫자 값을 입력하세요.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the pre-approvers to be individuals or jobs. Next, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of pre-approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC pre-approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of pre-approvers with the same order number. After all such pre-approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next pre-approver(s). If a pre-approver is a job, then any person in that job can pre-approve the MOC.
이 마지막 사전 승인자는 삭제할 수 없습니다. 이 사전 승인은 사람들의 Frontline 데스크톱에 있으므로 사전 승인자가 한 명 이상 있어야 합니다. 마지막 사전 승인자를 삭제하려면 새 사전 승인자를 추가하세요.
There are no pre-approvers in the Desktop Shortcut: #1 . Please click on the New button to add pre-approvers to the Desktop Shortcut.

Instructions: To reorder Pre-Approvers, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of nodes can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.
해당 사용자의 바탕 화면에서 바로가기를 삭제하시겠습니까?

Instructions: To add this MOC pre-approval shortcut to users' desktops, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people and then click Save.

Note: You can attach a file to a Requirement by selecting the "Browse" or "Choose File" button and selecting a file from the file explorer. Instead, you can attach a form to the Requirement by selecting it from the Form drop-down. To preview the form you have selected, click View.

To add new Requirement: Enter Title, Description, other information and then click on Save.
Note:A Requirement can also be linked to a document using the file path from the URL field. This is useful if Requirement needs a check sheet; for example, HAZOP Review. The hyperlink is displayed to Evaluator to review while completing the requirement.

To add a new Route: Enter Route Name, Route Code, and any other necessary information. Click Save.
Note: Routes are pre-defined Approval patterns that can be selected by Originators for a given type of MOC. Each route has Nodes - a Node is an Approver that makes up a part of the Route.
이 경로와 연결된 노드가 있으므로 경로를 삭제할 수 없습니다.

To Add Nodes: For People node names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter node order, then click on Save. For Job Title node names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter node order, then click on Save.
Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Node Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Nodes in parallel get MOC in their 'Inbox' simultaneously. All parallel Nodes have to approve before MOC goes to next Node. If Node is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before MOC goes to the next Node.
노드가 없습니다. 이 경로에 노드를 추가하려면 새로 만들기를 클릭하세요.

Instructions: To reorder nodes, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of nodes can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.

To attach an action item to a form: Fill out the fields below and click Save. Then, to associate the action item with a form field, click on the Details tab and then click on Layout to access the form designer. Next, right-click on the field to which you want to add action items, select Edit and scroll down to see the field options. Note that you can only add action items to the following field types: radio buttons, check boxes and drop-down menus. Select action items from the drop-down menus in the "Action Item" column. Each action item selected in this column will be automatically added to the MOC when the option next to it is selected.

To add new Memo MOC: Enter Title, select a Ref Code and an Expected Completion Date, and fill out all other required fields. Click Save.

Note:
1. The MOC number is generated by appending 'Ref Code' + a unique Division Identifier number + current year + sequential number.
2. Click on the Procedure button to review guidelines for submitting Memo MOCs, if provided by your administrator.
3. Memo MOC will generate an MOC with the Originator as the only approver and Send Notice as the only requirement.

참가자에게 이 MOC에 대한 즉시 이메일을 보냅니다.
PSM MOC에는 설명, 기술 기반, 환경 및 안전 영향을 입력해야 합니다.
태그는 진행 중인 MOC에 플래그를 지정하거나 표시하는 데 사용할 수 있는 사전 정의된 단어 또는 문구입니다.
프로필은 MOC 카테고리 또는 클래스에 대한 우선순위, MOC 유형, 구현 관리자, 평가 요구 사항, 협력자, 승인자, 구현 요구 사항, 첨부 파일, 장비 및 기타 여러 매개 변수를 미리 정의할 수 있는 템플릿입니다.
영향을 받는 PSI, COSOP, 통제 및/또는 통제 문서를 포함한 모든 변경 사항에 대한 자세한 설명.
변경이 제안된 이유와 변경이 관련 PHA, OEM, RAGAGEP 및/또는 규제 기관의 모든 요구 사항을 충족하거나 초과하도록 보장하는 방법.
완전한 문장을 사용하여 건강, 안전 또는 환경에 대한 긍정적이거나 부정적인 영향을 설명합니다. 여기에는 PPE 필요, 사고 또는 부상 위험, 유출 가능성, 폐기물 발생 등의 변경이 포함될 수 있습니다.
다음 중 하나 이상을 참고하십시오: MFG, DS01, DS02, RX01, RX02, TF01, 냉각기, 유틸리티, ChemOps 시설, EHS.
이 MOC가 PSM에 포함되지 않는 것이 확실합니까?\nMOC가 적용되는 프로세스에 영향을 미치는 프로세스 화학 물질, 기술, 장비, 절차 또는 시설 변경에 적용되거나 영향을 미치는 경우 PSM MOC로 간주됩니다.\n해당 프로세스는 다음과 같습니다. EHS.046 PSM 현장 적용 문서에 정의되어 있습니다.
본 MOC는 이미 평가 단계에 있거나 평가 단계를 통과했습니다.
평가를 시작하기 전에 이 MOC에 평가 요구 사항을 추가해야 합니다.
평가를 시작하기 전에 평가 탭에서 다음 요구 사항에 대한 평가자를 선택해야 합니다.
아래 평가 요구 사항에는 비활성 평가자가 있습니다. 평가를 시작하기 전에 평가 탭에서 재할당해야 합니다.
아래 평가 요구 사항에는 비활성 검증자가 있습니다. 평가를 시작하기 전에 평가 탭에서 이러한 요구 사항에 대한 다른 검증자를 선택해야 합니다.
본 MOC의 평가 요구사항 순서에 차이가 있습니다(요구사항이 누락될 수 있음). 평가를 시작하기 전에 평가 탭에서 이 문제를 해결해야 합니다.
이 MOC는 이미 협업 단계에 있거나 과거에 있습니다.
이 MOC에는 아직 평가 요구 사항이 불완전합니다. 협업을 시작하려면 먼저 이러한 요구 사항을 완료해야 합니다.
공동 작업을 시작하기 전에 이 MOC에 공동 작업자를 추가해야 합니다.
이 MOC의 작성자가 비활성 상태입니다. 협업을 시작하기 전에 다른 작성자를 선택해야 합니다.
아래 공동작업자는 비활성 상태입니다. 협업을 시작하기 전에 협업 탭에서 이를 교체해야 합니다.
해당 MOC는 이미 승인 단계에 있거나 승인 단계를 통과했습니다.
이 MOC에는 아직 평가 요구 사항이 불완전합니다. 승인을 시작하려면 먼저 이러한 요구 사항을 완료해야 합니다.
모든 공동작업자가 아직 공동작업을 완료하지 않았습니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 협업이 완료될 때까지 기다려야 합니다.
승인을 시작하기 전에 승인 탭에서 이 MOC에 승인자를 추가해야 합니다.
이 MOC의 작성자가 비활성 상태입니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 다른 작성자를 선택해야 합니다.
이 MOC의 구현 관리자가 비활성 상태입니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 다른 구현 관리자를 선택해야 합니다.
아래 승인자는 비활성 상태입니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 승인 탭에서 교체해야 합니다.
승인을 시작하기 전에 구현 탭에서 다음 요구 사항을 완료해야 합니다.
승인을 시작하기 전에 구현 탭에서 다음 요구 사항에 대한 구현자를 선택해야 합니다.
아래 구현 요구 사항에는 비활성 구현자가 있습니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 구현 탭에서 재할당해야 합니다.
아래 구현 요구 사항에는 비활성 검증자가 있습니다. 승인을 시작하기 전에 구현 탭에서 이러한 요구 사항에 대해 다른 검증자를 선택해야 합니다.
본 MOC의 구현 요구사항 순서에 차이가 있습니다(요구사항이 누락될 수 있음). 승인을 시작하기 전에 구현 탭에서 이 문제를 해결해야 합니다.
사전 승인자 순서에 차이가 있습니다. 주문번호를 확인하신 후 다시 시도해 주세요.

To Add Pre-Approvers: For People names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter order, then click on Save. For Job Title names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter order, then click on Save.

Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Pre-Approvers in parallel get MOC in their 'In Basket' simultaneously. All parallel Pre-Approvers have to approve before MOC goes to next Pre-Approver. If the Pre-Approver is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before MOC goes to the next Pre-Approver.

Instructions: To add collaborators, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of collaborators can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3).The MOC collaboration task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of collaborators with the same order number. After all such collaborators finish collaborating, the MOC will go to the next collaborator(s).

Instructions: To reorder collaborators, enter the new order numbers in the New Order column and then click Update. The order of collaborators can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3), and the order numbers must start from 1.

Instructions: To add approvers from a route, enter your route search criteria, click Search, select the appropriate route and then click Save.
Note: Routes are pre-defined approval patterns that you can create in Elements > Route. After searching, click on the route name to display the individuals and/or jobs in the route.

Instructions: The list of collaborators for this MOC is on the right. Select the collaborators who will also be approvers for the MOC, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the approvers to be individuals or jobs. Next, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.

Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

Note:

  • The Required Field checkbox should be checked if you want the Assigner of the Action Item to enter a value for this field.

  • To view available fields, click on Action Items from the System menu, click on In Process and then click on New button.

Instructions: To import action items from an Excel file and add them to the event #1, please follow these steps:
  1. Make sure that your Excel file contains the action item titles in one column.
  2. Browse to the file's location on your computer and select it.
  3. Enter the worksheet number (e.g., 1, 2, 3), the number of the first row (e.g., 1, 2, 3) and the letter of the column (e.g., A, B, C) containing the data. If the starting row contains the column name, select the check box.
  4. To import descriptions of your action items, select Import Descriptions. The descriptions must be in the column directly to the right of the action item titles.
  5. Click Import.
  6. Under Successfully Imported Action Items (Select to Add), select the check boxes next to the action items you wish to add; use the Check All button to select all action items in the list.
  7. Click Save to add the selected action items or Cancel to start again.

Instructions: To add default approvers from a route, enter your route search criteria, click Search, select the appropriate route and then click Save.
Note: Routes are pre-defined approval patterns that you can create in Elements > Route. After searching, click on the route name to display the individuals and/or jobs in the route.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the default approvers to be individuals or jobs. Next, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The event approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the event will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the event.

To Add Nodes: For People node names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter node order, then click on Save. For Job Title node names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter node order, then click on Save.
Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Node Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Nodes in parallel get Events in their 'In Basket' simultaneously. All parallel Nodes have to approve before Events goes to next Node. If Node is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before Events goes to the next Node.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of all MOCs. You can list In Process MOCs, Completed MOCs, and/or Voided MOCs by choosing YES on the ShowInProcess, ShowCompleted, and/or ShowVoided field filters.
Use this pre-built report to list all MOCs with their Title, Number, Priority, Approval Start Date and Stage. You can select an MOC from the list to see its details.
Select the Division. Enter any combination of search criteria. You may use % as a wildcard. Click Run Report. Click any MOC in the list to see the MOC Details.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC approval details for each MOC. For example, you can list Approvers who have MOCs on their Frontline desktop.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC equipment details for each MOC.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC requirement details for each MOC. For example, you can list Implementers who have not completed their assigned task.

This report, which is based on the Requirements report, was created specifically for Coffeyville. The report only includes implementation requirements of in-process Coffeyville Refinery and Fertilizer MOCs in which the "Maintenance Work Completion Confirmed in Field" requirement is complete (you can apply a filter on "Requirement Status" to see only incomplete requirements).

Use this custom report to list all the MOC requirement details including intermittent status for each MOC. For example, you can list Implementers who have entered progress with comments on their assigned task.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC Collaboration details for each MOC. For example, you can list Collaborators who have MOCs on their Frontline desktop.
Use this custom report to create a detailed list of MOC Action Items.
Use this custom report to show ACT fields for Action Items where titles match exactly with an In Process MOC title.
Use this custom report to view data for MOCs with a particular requirement form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.
Use this pre-built report to list past, scheduled emails sent by the MOC application. After running the report, you can click on a person's name to view the actual email he/she was sent.
enter your filter criteria, select a date range and email type and then click <b> Run Report </b >.
Use this report to view the training items, MOC tasks, action items, event tasks and shortcuts on a user's desktop.
Use this custom report to list Personal Agents. Most fields come from the Agent List Form.
Use this custom report to list Equipment. Most fields come from the Equipment Form.
Use this custom report to list RefCodes. Most fields come from the RefCode Form.
Use this custom report to list Requirements. Most fields come from the Requirement Form.
Use this custom report to list pre-designed approval routes. Most fields come from the Route and Route Nodes Form.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Action Items, including the complete history of each Action Item. You can list In Process Action Items, Completed Action Items and/or Voided Action Items by choosing the Yes option on the "Show In Process", "Show Completed" and/or "Show Voided" field filters.

Use this custom report to create a summarized list of Action Items, including only the most recent entry in the history of each Action Item. Use the "Awaiting Action By" field to find out whose desktop each Action Item is actually on.

This report, which is based on the Current Status of Action Items report, was created specifically for Ineos Oxide. The report only includes event action items associated with the following event forms: Audit, Carrier Review, Loss Control Tour, Loss Report, Meeting Report, Quality Message, Root Cause Investigation and Safety Prevention. The report also includes the "Type" field from these event forms.
Use this pre-built report to list Action Items with Title, Category, Number, Due Date, Priority, Assigned to Person and Status. You can further select an Action Item to see the details.
Select the Division. Enter any combination of search criteria. You may use % as a wildcard. Click Run Report. Click any Action Item in the list to see the Action Item details.

Use this pre-built report to list Action Items with their Title, Category, Number, Due Date, Priority, Assigned to Person and Status. In addition, if there are custom fields, you can list, sort and/or filter on them.
Select the Division. Customize the report. Move your cursor over Steps 1-5 in the column headers for detailed instructions for each step. Click Run Report or Export to Excel.

Use this pre-built report to list people who have received emails from the Action Tracking system. The report lists names, email addresses and the date the email was delivered. When you click on a name, Frontline displays an exact copy of the email.
Enter your filter criteria, select a date range, select the email type and then click <b> Run Report </b >.
Use this custom report to view data for action items with a particular form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Events. You can list In Process Events, Completed Events and/or Voided Events by choosing YES on the ShowInProcess, ShowCompleted, and/or ShowVoided field filters.
Use this custom report to list all the Event approval details for each Event. For example, you can list Approvers who have Events on their Frontline desktop.
Use this custom report to list all the Event Collaboration details for each Event. For example, you can list Collaborators who have Events on their Frontline desktop.
Use this pre-built report to list all Events with their Title, Category, Type, Date Started and Stage. If you select a Event from the report list, you can see its details.
Select the Division. Enter any combination of search criteria. You may use % as a wildcard. Click Run Report. Click any Event in the list to see the Event details.
Use this custom report to view data for events with a particular form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.
This report is a combination of the Event Form Fields and Current Status of Action Items reports. It displays one row per event action item, including the latest entry in each action item's history.
Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Events that use the Texas - Incident Report Form. The values from the user defined field check boxes will be displayed as comma-separated list.
Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Events that use the Event Reporting EME-MGT-03 Form. The values from the user defined field check boxes will be displayed as comma-separated list.
This custom report list all the Status Codes. The Status codes are used on People Information page.
This custom report list all the System Codes.
This custom report displays listing of session by users.
This page will allow you to add report templates.
Allows you to view all MOC profiles with selected attributes (e.g., all profiles in which a certain user is an approver).

Use this custom report to create a summarized list of PHA Action Items, including only the most recent entry in the history of each Action Item. Use the "Awaiting Action By" field to find out whose desktop each Action Item is actually on.

Instructions

  • The cells (pages) of this lesson are organized into topics () in the tree on the left. Click on a topic to display the cells within it, and click on a cell to view its content and make changes to it.
  • There are three types of cells:
    • Display cells () are used for training content, including text, pictures and video.
    • Question cells () are non-graded review questions designed to test learners' understanding of the training content during the course.
    • Remediation cells () are shown after learners answer lesson questions incorrectly.
  • Note: If "Free Navigation" is enabled, learners can use the tree (accessed from the "Map" button on the course's navigation bar) to skip to any page in the course.

Lesson Layout Toolbar

  • Topic (Add, Delete and Rename): You can use these functions to add new topics, remove topics and rename them. When you add a topic, it is placed after the selected topic. To add a topic to the beginning of the lesson, select the lesson title at the top of the tree and then click Add.
  • Cell (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new cells to this lesson, move cells around and remove them. When you add or paste a cell, it is placed after the selected cell. To add/paste a cell at the beginning of a topic, select the topic and then click Add/Paste.
  • Find and Replace: Allows you to search for and replace a word or phrase within the selected lesson, topic or cell.
  • Change Edit Number: Allows you to track minor changes to this lesson.
  • Create Test: Creates a test using this lesson's questions. The test is attached to the same training item and given the same title as the lesson.
  • Organize Cells: Allows you to move cells from one topic to another.
  • Print Lesson: Displays the lesson in printable format in a new browser window.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this test are organized into topics () in the tree on the left. Click on a topic to display the questions within it, and click on a question () to view it and make changes.
  • Note: If you organize the questions into multiple topics, you can configure the "Number of Questions to Ask" so that a certain number of questions is randomly selected from each topic during the test.

Test Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this test, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of a topic, select the topic and then click Add/Paste.
  • Find and Replace: Allows you to search for and replace a word or phrase within the selected test, topic or question cell.
  • Change Edit Number: Allows you to track minor changes to this test.
  • Print Test: Displays the test in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want learners to take the test on paper).
  • Print Answer Key: Displays the test with the correct answers in printable format in a new browser window.
  • Import Test Questions: Allows you to import questions from another test in Frontline.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this survey are organized in the tree on the left.
  • Click on a question () to view it and make changes.

Survey Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this survey, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of the survey, select the survey title at the top of the tree and then click Add/Paste.
  • Print Survey: Displays the survey in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want learners to take the survey on paper).
  • Import Survey Questions: Allows you to import questions from another survey in Frontline.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this assessment are organized in the tree on the left.
  • Click on a question () to view it and make changes.

Assessment Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this assessment, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of the assessment, select the assessment title at the top of the tree and then click Add/Paste.
  • Print Assessment: Displays the assessment in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want the assessor and learner to complete the assessment on paper).
  • Import Assessment Questions: Allows you to import questions from another assessment in Frontline.

An error has occurred. Please try the following:

  • If you were entering data, click Return to Previous Page, check your data and try again.
  • If you were running a report, click Return to Previous Page, check your filters and try the report again.
  • Log off Frontline, close and reopen your browser and log back in.
  • If the problem continues, please contact your main LMS/MOC/ACT administrator for assistance.

To add new User Defined Fields: Select Field Type, enter information in other required fields based on the field type you select and then click on Save button.
Note: If you wish to track the information in the field being entered via reports, check the Report checkbox and provide the Report Label if different from the Field Label.The Required Field checkbox should be checked if you want the Event Originator using this Template to enter a value for this field. Add only the fields that are not standard fields already available on all the Templates as you do not want to create redundant fields that may be confusing to user of the Template. To view the standard fields click on the Create Layout button.

To Copy Ad-hoc Action Item: Select Category, select Ref Code, enter Title, Description, select Priority, Classification, Type and enter other information and then click on Save.
Note:The Action Item number is generated by appending first four characters of Category + 'Ref Code' + a unique Division Identifier number + current year + sequential number. The Due Date for Action Item will be Today's date + Days To Complete.

Instructions: To add collaborators, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of collaborators can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The event collaboration task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of collaborators with the same order number. After all such collaborators finish collaborating, the event will go to the next collaborator(s).

"To add a new collaborator to the event '#1', enter your search criteria, click Search, select the person from the list that appears, enter an order number and then click Save.

Instructions: To add default collaborators, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people, enter order numbers and then click Save.

After all such collaborators finish collaborating, the event will go to the next collaborator(s).

선택적 사전 승인 단계에서 모든 사전 승인자는 "사전 승인" 데스크톱 작업을 사용하여 MOC 요청을 승인하거나 거부해야 합니다. 모든 사전 승인자가 승인하지 않으면 MOC는 자동으로 무효화됩니다. 최소한 한 명의 사전 승인자가 승인하면 MOC는 자동으로 새 단계로 들어갑니다.
선택적 사전 승인 단계에서 모든 사전 승인자는 "사전 승인" 데스크톱 작업을 사용하여 MOC 요청을 승인해야 합니다. 사전 승인자 중 한 명이 승인을 거부하면 MOC는 자동으로 무효화됩니다. 모든 사전 승인자가 승인하면 MOC는 자동으로 새 단계로 들어갑니다.
새로운 단계에서 작성자는 MOC를 변경할 수 있으며 평가, 협업 또는 승인을 시작해야 합니다.
선택적 평가 단계에서는 모든 평가 요구 사항을 완료해야 합니다. 이러한 작업이 완료된 후 작성자는 협업이나 승인을 시작해야 합니다.
선택적 협업 단계 동안 모든 공동 작업자는 "Collaborate" 데스크톱 작업을 완료해야 합니다. 협업이 완료되면 작성자가 승인을 시작해야 합니다.
MOC가 승인 단계에 들어가면 작성자는 MOC를 변경할 수 없습니다. 승인 중에 모든 승인자는 "승인" 데스크톱 작업을 사용하여 MOC를 승인해야 합니다. 승인자 중 한 명이 승인하지 않으면 MOC는 자동으로 무효화됩니다. 모든 승인자가 승인하면 MOC는 자동으로 구현 단계에 들어갑니다.
구현 단계에서는 모든 중요한 요구 사항과 중요한 작업 항목을 완료해야 합니다. 이러한 작업이 완료된 후 구현 관리자는 자신의 "시작" 데스크톱 작업을 사용하여 MOC 시작을 승인해야 합니다.
시작 단계에서는 모든 중요하지 않은 요구 사항, 중요하지 않은 작업 항목 및 MOC 통지 승인이 완료되어야 합니다. 이러한 작업이 완료된 후 작성자는 "완료" 데스크톱 작업을 사용하여 MOC를 종료해야 합니다.
학습자는 하나의 기본 작업만 가질 수 있습니다.

Instructions: WPCF Personnel can add external learning records for courses and classes (i.e., CEU records) that have been completed outside of Frontline. Independent contractors can add the contractor safety program training & test records for their personnel using the external learning function. Learners can add their external learning records using the External Learning link in the user desktop’s Quick Links Section (top right hand corner). To add a new external learning record for the selected learner, fill out the fields below and then click Save.
Note: External learning records are kept separate from learners’ Frontline training records. To view all learners’ external learning records, use the External Learning report in Reports > People.
